5. Time to expiration. Because volatility is expressed per unit of time, longer time to
expiration effectively increases expected volatility and increases the value of a call
option. Less time to expiration decreases the time value of a call option so that at
expiration it value is simply its intrinsic value.
For most put options, longer time to expiration will increase option values for the
same reasons. For some European put options, however, extending the time to
expiration can decrease the value of the put. In general, the deeper a put option
is in the money, the higher the risk-free rate, and the longer the current time to
expiration, the more likely that extending the option's time to expiration will
decrease its value.
